private_information: I arrive at Sunset District at 09:00
I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
Travel time from Sunset District to Union Square is 30 minutes
Travel time from Union Square to Sunset District is 26 minutes
traveler.goal: Plan my day to meet friends and meet Sarah for at least 15 minutes while maximizing number of meetings.

private_information: I will be at Union Square from 12:30 to 21:30
I can meet for at least 15 minutes within that window
friend_sarah.goal: Provide availability constraints and preferences for meeting times at Union Square.

orchestrator.goal: Combine candidate schedules and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner to find an optimal schedule that respects travel times and meeting constraints and maximizes meetings, ensuring Sarah is met at least 15 minutes within her availability.

public_information: Travel times: Sunset District to Union Square = 30 minutes
Travel times: Union Square to Sunset District = 26 minutes
You arrive at Sunset District at 09:00
Sarah will be at Union Square from 12:30 to 21:30
Meeting with Sarah must be at least 15 minutes

propose_schedule.system_prompt: You are the traveler agent. Based on public information and your private information, propose several candidate schedules for your day. Each candidate should list a sequence of locations with planned arrival and departure times and any proposed meeting durations with named friends. Do not emit PDDL. Output a concise structured schedule representation labeled as schedule_traveler.
propose_schedule.prompt: Your name is traveler. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->traveler->goal}. Propose multiple candidate schedules that respect travel times and start time. Provide times and proposed meeting durations. Do not assume unknown facts.

propose_availability.system_prompt: You are friend_sarah. Provide your exact availability windows, any preferences for meeting times, and minimum meeting lengths. Do not emit PDDL. Output a concise structured availability representation labeled as schedule_sarah.
propose_availability.prompt: Your name is friend_sarah. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->friend_sarah->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->friend_sarah->goal}. Provide availability constraints and preferences that the orchestrator can use to build a PDDL model.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL for the FastDownwards planner. Receive candidate schedules and availability reports from agents and produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encodes locations, travel times, time windows, minimum meeting duration constraints, and an objective to maximize number of meetings while ensuring Sarah is met at least 15 minutes within her available window. Keep actions for different agents distinct when modeling. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the traveler's candidate schedules and Sarah's availability. Integrate those inputs: {schedule_traveler} {schedule_sarah}. Build a PDDL domain and problem that captures time as discrete minutes or suitable time steps, travel durations between Sunset District and Union Square, Sarah's availability window, the traveler's start time and location, and an objective to maximize meetings while satisfying the minimum 15-minute meeting with Sarah. Target the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
